head.title: Treasury Bill Auctions Set for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Bill Auctions Set for This Week
hedline.hl2: Treasury Bill Auctions Set for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.12 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.17 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.90 percent.
The Treasury’s schedule of financing this week includes today’s regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.12 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.17 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.90 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
Industry Public Facility Authority, $173.3 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
South Carolina Transportation Infrastructure, $111 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Aurora, Ill., and Dupage, Will and Kendall Counties, $75 million of collateralized single-family mortgage revenue bonds. Morgan Keegan.
Dormitory Authority of the State of New York, $240 million of debt securities for St. John's University. Morgan Stanley.
Ector County Independent School District, Odessa, Tex., $56.4 million of unlimited tax refunding bonds. First Southwest Company.
McLennan County Junior College District, Waco, Tex., $74.2 million of limited tax bonds. UBS.
Platte River Power Authority, Fort Collins, Colo., $102.5 million of power revenue bonds. Goldman Sachs.
Santa Monica, Calif., Community College District, $67.9 million of general obligation bonds. RBC Capital Markets.
Oregon Department of Administrative Services, Salem, Ore., $154.2 million of Oregon State Lottery revenue bonds. Bank of America.
Wichita Falls, Tex., $108.6 million of priority lien refunding revenue bonds for its water and sewer system. RBC Capital Markets.
